The devs know what the problem with Boon: Circle of Healing is and refuse to fix it; the fact that it's a free 5th perk for 3 out of 4 teammates when 1 person brings it. Just and infinitely-replacable AoE of increased healing speed and free self-healing without needing another perk or medkit.

And if Killers snuff it? Survivors can replace it. So either Killers waste time snuffing it, or allow Survivors free healing speed, which means less time spent healing and more times licking gens.
So lose/lose for the supposed 'power role' of Killers.

Add to that that gen-tapping is still broken AF; Killers spend 3 seconds kicking a gen to regress it, Survivors can literally 1-frame of animation (1/60th of a second) tap that gen mid-chase to stop said regression...

I'm fully expecting the devs to add a Boon that allows Survivors to erase hook-states so Killers can never get kills. They seem insanely out of touch with their player base, and they clearly play Survivor more than Killer.
Survivors have 16 perks per match (4 perks per Survivor & 4 Survivors) and Killers get 4. Yet Survivors have at least 5 second-chance perks to erase damage, dodge damage, or get out of the Killer's grasp before he can hook them.
So the math on that; 16 second-chance perks, per match. And gen speeds have not been touched; matches are still 6-7 minutes long. 
And yet Killers are attacked, insulted, and THREATENED if they don't do their level best to get 3 hook states per Survivor. That's how entitled the Survivor player base as become. They can clear 3 out of 5 generators before the first chase ends, and yet they fully expect their opponent to throttle back and attempt to 'play fair'.

I stopped playing when I heard Survivors actually claim such things as 'The Killer should think about our fun' and 'If people are not having fun; something should be changed' but that argument only worked in favor of Survivors. 
When I looked at the forums recently, a major post was 'Killers should never 4K because they never kill everyone in movies'. That is the level of entitlement Survivors have come to expect from the choices BHVR has made over the years.

Add to that that every Killer. Every. Single. One. Looks AWESOME on the beta branch before release.
But they ALWAYS get nerfed. There's ALWAYS some excuse after the devs have roped suckers into preordering the DLC.

Sorry but the devs don't respect half the playerbase (The Killers) and the Survivors don't, either.
Don't buy this game if you want to play Killer; it's a mess of weak garbage and entitled opponents who will threaten your life if you break their fake rules.

But this is just the view of someone bitter with how completely skewed the game has become.
Maybe insults and threats slide off your back. If so; you're more of a saint than I am, dear reader.
As for me; I'll just watch Otzdarva play it; He gets more fun out of it than I ever will.

Не оригинальная, но довольно интересная идея Dead by Daylight получила свой отклик. Сдается мне, что основным способом распространения игры и ее рекламой стали сами пользователи. Еще бы, вышло очень атмосферно - ночь, замкнутое пространство и непокидающее чувство опасности или охоты. 

Основу геймплея составляет изначальный выбор роли жертвы или убийцы. Вариант зависит от личных предпочтений каждого и желания пощекотать нервы.

Участь жертв далеко не радужна. 4 персонажа (на момент написания обзора) с настраиваемым внешним видом и личными перками, которые неоднократно могут выручить при попытках спастись от рук / бензопилы / молота / прочих предметов и частей тела маньяка, дабы сбежать из ограниченной небольшими размерами местности. Пока герои пытаются запустить ненавистные генераторы, чтобы открыть ворота, или найти спасительный люк, за ними непрерывно ведется охота. Малейшая ошибка, излишняя самоуверенность, небрежная прогулка по открытой местности, и вы обнаружите себя или подставите других. 

Звуковой ряд очень важен для "смертельных пряток", в которые вас втянули. Шелест травы, крики птиц, звуки ремонта, открытия дверей и предметов играют против вас. Тишина, тьма и любые укрытия, напротив, ваши друзья, поскольку против убийцы практически нет шансов. 

Выбрав одного из монстров, взятых из популярных фильмов ужасов, рисковать не придется. Методично выслеживайте уцелевших, пресекайте пути к отступлению и спасению раненых. Жертвы будут сопротивляться своей поимке, но кто они, а кто вы? Убийца обладает рядом преимуществ, вроде более высокой скорости передвижения, невидимости или возможности расставить капканы.

На текущий момент игра остро нуждается в доработке. От бета-версии она ушла совсем недалеко. Карт мало, некоторые плохо проработаны, локализация отсутствует, проблема с поиском лобби, много багов и частые зависания. Хромой баланс, неоднозначные решения, подобно исключительно приватным серверам (без начисления опыта) для друзей. 

К тому же, Dead by Daylight требует постоянных обновлений, иначе рискует погрязнуть в однообразии. Безусловно, в игре есть потенциал, но над ним стоит хорошо поработать.

"Dead by Daylight", or as I like to call it, "Kite the Killer," is a disappointment on some many different levels. The idea of the game itself seems promising, but in its current state, I'm afraid it fails one too many levels to be fun.

The public seems to have caught the 4v1 genre bug, and two of the most current titles that come to mind are (the superior) "Unfortunate Spacemen" and impending "Friday the 13th" release. I've certainly caught this bug and had high hopes for this game, but my heart sank quickly after I began playing the game.

First, let me explain how a round is won. As the Killer, you must find and melee hit a survivor twice (or once with the comically useless "Chainsaw" trait, but more on that later). On the second hit, you pick the survivor up, and must find a sacrifice hook to hang the survivor on, which if left there, after about a min or two, the hook comes alive and "digests" the survivor. Okay....
As one of four survivors, you must start three of six generators to restore power to open one of three electrical doors and escape, thus winning the round.

#1 The survivors have no real way to attack the Killer, however, they run just about as fast as the killer, and are capable of pushing debris and obstacles in front of the Killer's path. They are able to leap through windows about 75% faster than a killer can climb through. So in essence, speed is absolutely on the survivors side -- and in most cases, this is absolutely a problem, hence the laughable kiting. It's hard enough to find a survivor as it is, and when the Killer finally does come barreling down on them, the survivor has 2 practically fail-safe ways to escape: Spam debris pushes while running in a zig-zag pattern or run to a two-story house, where the survivor will run to the upper balcony and wait for the Killer to lumber on up, before jumping off. When the Killer pursues, the survivor just runs back up, rinse, repeat until the Killer gets disorientated or annoyed and leaves, or the remaining three survivors turn on the generators. I've never seen a game penalize a hunter for cornering his prey.

#2 While the description of this game "emphasizes" team work, I've never seen a team-game promote the team splitting up and having everyone go solo. The maps, are a good medium-to large size, with numerous generators to start at all corners of the map. When the team splits up, say north, south, east, west, this makes the killers run around, chasing his own tail, even though he is alerted to the generators starting up. This takes time, which allows the numerous survivors just repair away, no problem. But even if the killer does pick a correct generator that a survivor is at ...

#3 ... The survivors have numerous alerts to let them the Killer is coming to them. First, there is a "Heart-beat" system, which basically an alarm is giving the survivors a good 5 second warning the Killer is headed their way. There are also numerous perks which allow a survivor to know if the Killer is looking in their direction, i.e. actually has a clue where they are currently hiding. Any chance of stealth and successfully navigating to a survivor’s position on the Killer's part is undercut by the numerous alarms the survivors have, who will immediately hide upon hearing those alarms. The Killer can attempt to find the survivor in the area, all while three other survivors diligently work on their generators. The moment the Killer moves out of the area, and the alarms stop, the survivor returns working on the generator -- rinse repeat. If the Killer does miraculously find the survivor ... Kite the Killer, waste his time. Rinse, Repeat.

#4 Practically all Killer abilities are useless. The ones that aren't barely do anything. Vanilla Killer is Vanilla Killer. The Killer can have three loadouts: The "Bear-Trap" loadout ... allows the killer to place traps around the map to snare a survivor. Sounds like a good idea and possibly an answer to the circular kiting, but wait, even though there are like 10 traps spread out through the map, you can only have one active at a time. That makes sense. You have the "Wraith" loadout which makes you invisible, however it takes a good 4 seconds for you to re-materialize, and your presence, while invisible, still alerts the survivor that you are in the area -- and by the time you re-materialize, the survivors see you and the Kiting begins. And finally you have the "Chainsaw" loadout, which is 100% useless. The chainsaw give you a charge ability that if you actually hit a survivor, instantly knocks them down for you to pick-them up and hook them, however, while fast, you can only charge in a straight line, attacking the first thing you clip. This means that the by simply listening for the chainsaw to rev (it takes about three seconds for the ability to charge and release) the survivor can turn left or right, or simply move a piece of debris in the Killer's path. The Killer will either miss the mark complete and go charging way out of the vicinity (if the Killer is lucky enough to even find an open patch of map) or he will clip any little thing before even getting to the survivor, comically slamming into walls, debris etc., while the survivor kites.

#5 The matchmaking system is a joke. Like the best joke of the year. You're a level 1 Killer? Well prepare to go again level 20 survivors who are just full of perks. Get ready to be taunted by a team of 4, who will turn on all 6 generators for the hell of it, and open all 3 exits, while running circles around you, while spamming you with their flashlights and kiting you.

#6 With team-making patches, get ready for #5 issues to go through the roof as players use Skype or someone outside com program to coordinate with one another, while the Killer stands in the middle of the map getting rolled.

#7 Even, if by grace of the Gaming-Gods you are able to attack and capture a survivor, the hooks (unlike the mob of generators) are spread thin, all over the map.  And, to top it off, the survivor can still escape your clutches while being carried.  I'd say realistically you have about 20 seconds to get the survivors to a hook before they break free.  Did I mention you move twice as slow carrying a survivor?  Did I mention when the survivor escapes, you are basically kicked downwards and spun around for a few seconds, giving that survivor a head start ... to start the Kite game over?  Rinse.  Repeat.

If this was a finished product upon purchase, I would have returned it, but I try to support studios and products that have potential, so I kept it and will see how it pans out.  In closing, the concept has potential ... but I really don't hold out much hope.  I just don't see how the devs are going to fix and balance these problems, without major overhauls.  As it stands, on paper and in the trailers, the game looks awesome.  Actual execution -- sucks.

I throughly enjoy this game. I feel that the game is balance, it rewards smart plays, punishes bad ones. I hear a lot of negative thoughts on the game, and what I have to say in regard to those? 'You're not doing it Right'. 

"The Killers are too Weak" - Correction, you're not playing them right. Playing the killers requires thought before action, play mind games with the survivors. I see a lot of killers attempting to just straight up chase and kill like the climax of a horror movie, you need to build up to the climax where the survior is desperate to leave. Make them panic, make them make choices faster, you need to control both sides of emotions and thoughts,

"Survivors are too Weak" - Survivors also have to play mind games, this does not mean find one spot and jump over it constantly, you will die this way to a smart killer. The flashlight 'does' work but you need to know how to aim at the face, not wiggle it around like you're shooing the killer. The medkit is helpful because that means you won't get hit once and fall next time, the tool box may not seem like it speeds up repairs but it does.

Overall the complaining of this game gets me pretty down, the developers are pretty good, they can add a few features and tweak a few mechanics but I throughly believe this game to be good.

Honestly unlike any other game I've ever played. This game pits 4 players, playing as human survivors, against 1 player, playing as some supernaturally gifted killer. The goal is simple, yet can take a long time to master: Survivors must find and repair 5 Generators scattered around the map, then open up the Exit Gates, and escape. The Killer's must prevent this by finding and hitting the survivors twice, then carrying them to a Hook. Once hooked, the Survivor must wait for a teammate to rescue them. Get hooked three times, or stay on the hook too long, and you die. The game has no time limit, and only ends when all 4 Survivors have either died or escaped. 

The game has a nice balance between the sides. Neither side is OP, though many noobs may disagree. Each player picks up to 4 perks, which greatly change your playstyle. Each map is procedurally generated, so no two games are alike. Finally, each side is a completely different experience. Playing as Killer is nothing like playing as Survivor. 

The game is good with or without friends as well.

DbD ist ein Spiel mit dem gleichen Prinzip wie Evolved das 4vs1 Matches beinhalted.

Die Ziele auf beiden Seiten sind simpel. Die Survivor müssen überleben und fliehen, wobei der Killer sie daran hindern muss.

Zur Auswahl stehen 3 blutrünstige Killer und 4 Survivors. 

Durch verschiedene Aktionen auf beiden Seiten verdient man sich Blutpunkte.

Great concept of a game, but it's nothing new nor has it been QA'ed properly. Game crashed frequently for me ruining some fun games I actually did have while learning. Some random small bugs but nothing game breaking, bigger problem was connection problems making game pretty laggy at times. Damned, a game with a very very similar concept and gameplay, also suffered connection issues, but never crashed for me and was much more spoopy. This game is definitely horror themed but is more frantic/thriller rather than horror. To compare in movies, Damned is The Ring, and Dead by Daylight is Texas Chainsaw Massacre. 

Final Verdict: Fun game during the times it did not crash for me but barely got to finish most games because of those crashes. Sure, i could look up solutions, but i shouldn't need to do that for something i'm purchasing. Not worth the money so I refunded it. Purchase Damned instead for this sort of game, which has little bugs, no crashes, custom lobbies to play with your friends without a need to dodge queues constantly, and much more spoopy gameplay with the same concept, get objectives and escape the area.

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Moderately fast loading times
+ Customizable survivors and killers
+ Skills/abilities for survivors and killers
+ 'Some' ways to hide from killers
+ 'Some' ways to evade killers
+ Survivors cooperate with other survivors to escape together
+ Killers bait survivors 
+ Killers have limited visilbity range (first person view only)
+ Survivors have more visibility range (third person)
+ Killers can set traps 
+ Survivors can find and disarm certain traps when not running
+ Survivors blend in with the environment really well
+ Multiplayer random online play or private lobby options
+ Sound effects are good
+ Multiple exits 
+ Multiple generators (objectives, at least 5 need to be activated/completed) 
+ When killers are near, they are given red glows for what they see making it
+ Heartbeat rises automatically when a killer is near

[b]Cons[/b]
- Killers move way too fast
- No way to communicate to survivors during game
- Hiding in certain areas can be pretty pointless
- Escape after getting struck becomes difficult to impossible
- Items don't stay (but you can pick up more unless you die)
- Can not hold multiple items 
- No real chase
- Cooperative strategies are extremely limited
- Evading capture becomes difficult to impossible after getting downed by a killer
- Rescuing others becomes difficult to impossible after they ar downed by the killer
- The chase is 4 seconds to 15 seconds long
- Levels become extremely repetitive over time
- Objectives become repetitive, not much else to do
- Environment lacks significant difference; one has more clutter than the other
- Lobby matches with friends can only be private
- Only up to 4 survivors
- Needs 5 players to officially start a match
- Players need to be sacrificed to be killed 
- If killer doesn't find the survivor (%chance), there may be brief moments of wandering 
- Survivor won't stop making panic noises, can be really annoying at times - kind of like watching a horror movie with stereotypes

[b]The Dealbreaker[/b]
Working together becomes more difficult because you can not talk to each other while in game. If anything, I would have hoped for some kind of cooperation between players. Instead, everyone is deaf mute and can not speak to each other. It is all, "lets try to guess what he or she wants me to do." The most successful matches - is not working together, it's baiting the killer. If you get caught, the other survivors have a chance to escape or to complete the objectives. I have not played with friends yet but apparently you can't join other games with your friends - this would be a huge deal breaker. 

[b]Conclusion[/b]
This game's concept is great. It has that atmosphere and terrifying moments of almost getting caught to being caught. After a while, I feel like there is no point in trying to escape. I have had matches where 20 seconds in, I'm already caught by a killer by just crouch walking in a general direction in grass. There are other games where I won't get seen until 3 minutes in to the rest of the game. Knock over this wall to create an obstacle, get outrunned anyway by the killer on the other side. It works every time for the killer. The open ended level balances well with the survivor's stealth options and killers speed. It gets pretty repetitive really fast. 

Playing as the killer and the survivor - both feels terrible. The rush as a killer isn't as fun as it was in games like "The Hidden" where you could taunt the players. Where you could corner the survivors and have them all panic. Instead, they're all just brief moments. As a survivor, you have a long period of crouching and steath, but once you're seen - you're kind of fucked. There is no chase. There is no complex strategy to chase as a killer or to evade as a survivor. It feels meh.

Estaba deseando escribir un análisis de este juego y, aunque en este momento en el que estoy escribiendo solo lleve 5 horas, creo que han sido suficientes para expresar mi opinión sobre Dead by Daylight.

Dead by Daylight es un juego del estilo survival horror multijugador 4vs1. Un asesino y 4 supervivientes, el asesino, deberá acabar con todos ellos sacrificándolos en ganchos, cuidándose de que los otros no le liberen, ya que hay personas muy coordinadas en este juego que pueden liartela en un momento.

Pero no solo hay un asesino sino 3 diferentes; El Trampero, Hill Billy y El Espectro. Cada uno con distintas habilidades que hacen que cada partida sea diferente y que los supervivientes deban enfrentarse al asesino de diversas formas en cada partida.

Mientras que los supervivientes, deberán huir de ellos de cualquier forma, reparando 5 generadores (si juegas una partida online normal con las 5 personas) y abriendo una puerta.
En cada una de estas fases salen quicktimes que tendrás que acertar pues sino harás un ruido que hasta los asesinos de otra partida oiran y se plantearan ir a matarte xD

Jugar como superviviente, personalmente me encanta, pues lo que necesitas es un equipo que coopere y que te ayude a ti y a todos y entre todos para conseguir un objetivo común, escapar.

En cuanto a ambientación, es muy buena, 3 mapas que van cambiando aleatoriamente (posición de generadores y ganchos) y una música juntada con los latidos del corazón que te pondrá en un estado de tensión increíble.

Por último decir que este juego lo ví por primera vez en gameplay de su beta y que desde el primer momento me captó, y creo que se merece un análisis positivo porque es muy bueno.
Un gran juego para los amantes del género Slasher de los noventa (Viernes 13 o Scream por ejemplo.

Es ist sehr empfehlenswert. Es findet im Spiel keine Kommunikation durch die anderen Survivor statt per Schreibchat oder sonstiges da es die Funktion NOCH nicht gibt. Doch trotzdem weiß jeder wer und wie er Gewinnen will. Die meisten schreiben auch Der Glockentyp sei OP da muss ich nur immer Lachen warum schaffe ich das dann immer vor ihm zu entkommen ? Man muss im Spiel seinen Kopf anstrengen und überlegen wo die beste Fluchtmöglichkeit besteht wenn der Killer kommt. Alle die am Überlegen sind sich das Spiel zu kaufen bitte schaut vorher euch gute Kommentare an von Leuten die mehr als 15 Spielstunden haben. Hier schreiben einige direkt nach 1 Stunde rein Das spiel ist zu verbuggt und Unfair ... eigentlich schade Das Spiel hat es nicht verdient es ist SUPER. Ich hoffe ich kann hiermit einige überzeugen das dieses Spiel sehr viel Potenzial hat. Somit würde ich mal sagen wir sehen uns in meinem Wald :)

В этой игре вы поймете, какого быть на месте Маньяка и его жертвы, пересмотрите свое мнение на сюжет фильмов ужасов с "банальной" развязкой, узнаете, насколько трудно и в то же время интересно искать в траве стонущую девушку, которая попала в капкан. У вас есть 2 основных оружия: глаза и уши! Внимательность и скоординированные действия-залог успеха, ну и соответственно удовольствия от игры. Но есть баги и прочие неедоработки, проект сыроват, но надеюсь разработчики знают чт оисправлять!
